benefits.title: Hands-On Leadership Experience
benefits.description: Tutoring, college prep, scholarship opportunities, and academic mentorship to help you succeed in school and beyond.

benefits.title: Personal and Professional Development
benefits.description: Hands-on leadership training, public speaking workshops, and opportunities to lead community projects.

benefits.title: Supportive Network of Emerging Leaders
benefits.description: Internship placements, job readiness training, resume building, and networking with industry professionals.

benefits.title: Clarity on Strengths and Leadership Style
benefits.description: Achievement certificates, scholarship opportunities, and public recognition for your contributions and growth.

benefits.title: Practical Skills in Communication...
benefits.description: Build confidence, develop emotional intelligence, and discover your passions through supportive mentorship.

benefits.title: Stronger Campus and Community Connections
benefits.description: Learn creative problem-solving, design thinking, and entrepreneurship skills for the modern world.

meetings.note:
Respectfully, No: Setting Boundaries Guilt-Free

Saying “no” doesn’t make you mean, it makes you mindful. Join this LEAD Series workshop to help you build the confidence to set healthy boundaries in your personal, academic, and professional life without guilt. Through real-life scenarios, reflective activities, and practical tools, you’ll learn how to communicate your needs clearly, protect your energy, and maintain strong relationships.

Lead Your Way: Embracing Neurodiversity in Leadership

Join this LEAD Series workshop as we highlight how neurodivergent perspectives can drive creativity, empathy, and innovation in leadership spaces. You’ll explore your individual strengths, learn how to navigate challenges, and gain tools to lead in ways that feel authentic to you.

Flop Era to Glow Up: Turning Failure into Fuel

Failure happens, and that’s okay! This LEAD Series workshop creates space to reflect on setbacks without shame, reframe what it means to “fail,” and learn how to bounce back stronger. Through honest conversations and practical strategies, you’ll explore how to grow from challenges and build resilience.

Say It With Your Chest: Speaking Up & Standing Strong

Finding your voice and speaking up can be challenging, but it is key to advocating for yourself and others. You’ll learn practical communication skills and ways to overcome fear or hesitation so you can say what matters with confidence.

End the Beef: How to Disagree Without Disrespect

This LEAD Series workshop teaches you how to manage disagreements respectfully. You’ll build emotional intelligence and active listening skills to turn conflict into positive collaboration.

Main Character Energy: A Workshop on Self-Love

This LEAD Series workshop is all about stepping into your main character energy by embracing self-love and self-care. You’ll explore ways to build confidence, set boundaries, and nurture a positive relationship with yourself.

learningOutcomes.text: Articulate their own leadership philosophy in the context of their multiple identities and values (i.e. school, professional, and community life).
Identify and apply key skills to effectively work with others in academic, professional, and community settings.
Identify and demonstrate strategies for how to enact change in various educational, professional, and community environments.

pathways.title: Leadership Engagement
pathways.description: Participants take on roles that require active commitment and development, including involvement in campus organizations and service initiatives.
bullets: Opportunities include ASI, U-SU Board, Student Health Advisory Committee, Student Athlete Advisor Committee, Orientation Leader, Tour Guide, Resident Assistants, RHA, Greek Life, and mentorship programs (RISE, Peer Leader Program, etc.).
Many also contribute through campus committees, Recognized Student Organizations, and College Corps.

pathways.title: Student-Led Innovation
pathways.description: Encouraged to propose projects, initiatives, or leadership roles aligned with the Social Change Model, participants shape their own development pathways.

pathways.title: Ongoing Involvement
pathways.description: Continued participation in leadership development opportunities throughout the year reinforces growth and aligns with Wingspan's mission.

pathways.title: Milestone Reflection
pathways.description: Completion of a final project—such as a reflection, essay, or video—demonstrates leadership growth and the impact made.

socialChangeValues.title: Consciousness of Self
socialChangeValues.description: Awareness of the beliefs, values, attitudes and emotions that motivate one to take action.

socialChangeValues.title: Congruence
socialChangeValues.description: Thinking, feeling and behaving with consistency, genuineness, authenticity and honesty towards others.

socialChangeValues.title: Commitment
socialChangeValues.description: The motivational energy that drives individuals to serve the collective effort; implies passion, intensity and duration.

socialChangeValues.title: Collaboration
socialChangeValues.description: Working with others in a common effort. It empowers self and others through trust.

socialChangeValues.title: Common Purpose
socialChangeValues.description: Facilitates the group’s ability to engage in collective analysis of issues at hand and the task to be undertaken.

socialChangeValues.title: Controversy with Civility
socialChangeValues.description: Respect for others, a willingness to hear each other's views, and accepting differences in viewpoints.

socialChangeValues.title: Citizenship
socialChangeValues.description: Fostering connections to society. Working for positive change on the behalf of others and the community.

requirements: Attend 3 LEAD Workshops OR the Student Leadership Conference
Become a member of at least 1 student organization
perks: Recognition at the annual Golden Eagle Awards
